thread.title: Will it be Carly Fiorina vs. Tim Kaine in 2018?
thread.title_full: Will it be Carly Fiorina vs. Tim Kaine in 2018? | Washington Examiner

author: Anna Giaritelli
title: Will it be Carly Fiorina vs. Tim Kaine in 2018?
text:
Former 2016 GOP presidential hopeful Carly Fiorina won't rule out a Senate run against Democratic Sen. Tim Kaine in Virginia in 2018.
The former Hewlett Packard CEO told radio host John Fredericks on Tuesday that she is "certainly looking at that opportunity."
"Look, I'm certainly looking at that opportunity ... it's a little early to be making that decision, we're two weeks into a new administration," Fiorina said.
In 2010, Fiorina ran against incumbent Sen. Barbara Boxer, D-Calif, but lost in the general election. Her most recent political endeavor was in 2015, when she announced she was seeking the Republican nominee for president. After dropping out in early 2016, Sen. Ted Cruz, R-Texas, picked Fiorina as his would-be running mate, though Donald Trump went on to win the nomination.

Fiorina and her husband live outside Washington, D.C., in northern Virginia. She said vying against Kaine, the former vice presidential nominee in Hillary Clinton 's campaign, would be a "very, very tough race."
"Who knows what the future will bring," Fiorina said , "but I look forward to continuing to talk to the people of the Commonwealth of Virginia about things that we agree on, things that we may not yet know we agree on."
